Slide.Title: Abandoned Farmhouse Near Theodore Roosevelt National Park
Slide.Desc: The landscape of western North Dakota is littered with structures like this.

Slide.Title: Abandoned Garage in Alexander, North Dakota
Slide.Desc: The painted circles add flair; perhaps they were part of the garage's logo.

Slide.Src: Open Road Over Handlebars Near Beach.jpg
Slide.Title: Montana 7 North of Baker
Slide.Desc: Most people drive about 80 mph; pickup trucks outnumber cars 4:1.

Slide.Title: Abandoned gas station/store in Plevna, Montana
Train Station in Beach, North Dakota
Slide.Desc: The trains are very active in this part of the country, but tend to haul great quantities of a single homogenous cargo such as gas or grain. One train we passed had over 100 grain cars - each car exactly the same.

Slide.Title: Wide-load Hay Hauling on US 85 South of Williston
Slide.Desc: Wide-load trucks and heavy agricultural equipment are common on these roads; one harvester we passed had to move into the ditch for every oncoming vehicle.

Slide.Title: Tornado Siren in Beach, North Dakota
Slide.Desc: It sounds a test every day at 12 noon; even a block away, the noise was ear-splitting.
